data: Fact-checked by Grok last week Dong-Kyun Ha Ha Dong-kyun (Korean: 하동균; born June 28, 1980), known professionally as Ha Dong Qn, is a South Korean singer-songwriter known for his deep vocal timbre, wide range, and emotive ballad performances that have established him as a respected vocalist in the Korean music industry. [1] [2] Born on June 28, 1980, in Seoul, he debuted in 2002 as a member of the short-lived vocal group 7Dayz before joining the boy band Wanted in 2004, where he has continued to perform despite intermittent hiatuses over the years. [1] [2] His solo career began in 2006 with the release of the single album DQ from WANTED, followed by notable works including the studio albums Stand Alone (2006) and Another Corner (2008), as well as the EPs Mark (2012), Word (2014), and Polygon (2017). [2] Ha has further broadened his recognition through frequent appearances on major television music and variety programs, such as I Am a Singer Season 3, Immortal Songs: Singing the Legend, The Call Season 2, Begin Again, and Killing Voice, where his vocal prowess and interpretive skills have been widely praised. [2] He has also served as a vocal trainer on programs like MIXNINE and taken on radio DJ roles, contributing to his enduring presence in South Korea's entertainment landscape. [1] Currently signed to M.AR.K Planet, Ha remains active as a performer and collaborator in the industry. [1] [3] Early life Early years and background Ha Dong-kyun was born on June 28, 1980, in Seoul, South Korea, specifically in the Jungnang-gu district (formerly part of Dongdaemun-gu). [4] His zodiac sign is Cancer, and he is Protestant Christian. [5] Early profiles list his height as 175 cm and blood type as O. [6] From childhood, Ha Dong-kyun developed a passion for music, particularly rock and heavy metal genres, listening to bands such as Whitesnake and Mr. Big while participating in rock bands during his youth. [7] These early experiences nurtured his dream of becoming a musician before his professional entry into the industry in 2002. [8] Career 2002–2005: Group debut with 7Dayz and Wanted Ha Dong-kyun began his career in 2002 as a member of the R&B boy band 7Dayz, debuting with the group's self-titled album on March 12, 2002 that included the track "내가 그댈." The group, consisting of members including Lee Jung, Jeon Sang-hwan, Seo Jae-ho, and Y.J, was short-lived and disbanded shortly after the release of their one album. [9] [2] Following the disbandment of 7Dayz, Ha Dong-kyun joined the boy band Wanted in 2004, debuting with the group alongside Seo Jae-ho, Jeon Sang-hwan, and Kim Ja-suk. Wanted released their debut album Like the First on June 4, 2004. However, in August 2004, the group was involved in a car accident that resulted in the death of member Seo Jae-ho and serious injuries to Ha Dong-kyun and Kim Ja-suk. This led to a hiatus in activities as Ha underwent rehabilitation. ) The group later continued intermittently with remaining members. 2006–2015: Solo debut and early albums In 2006, Ha Dong-kyun transitioned to a solo career, beginning with the digital single "DQ from WANTED" in early June, followed by his first full-length album Stand Alone on June 27, 2006. [1] [10] The album featured ballads that highlighted his vocal style and included the title track "그녀를 사랑해줘요," which helped establish him as a solo artist after a challenging period. [11] Stand Alone peaked at number 9 on the Korean album chart and sold more than 28,456 copies. He followed up with his second full album Another Corner on February 12, 2008, which peaked at number 4 on the chart and sold more than 9,246 copies. [12] After a quieter period, he returned with the mini-album Mark on December 17, 2012, led by the title track "From Mark." [10] In 2014, he released the mini-album Word on October 14, 2014, featuring the title track "Run." [10] His participation in I Am a Singer Season 3 from January to April 2015 brought renewed public attention, as he performed a mix of his own songs and covers across multiple rounds, earning praise for his vocal ability and leading to some tracks charting on digital platforms. [13] [14] This exposure highlighted his enduring appeal as a ballad singer during this phase of his career. 2016–present: Founding Mark Planet and recent activities In 2016, Ha Dong-kyun founded the independent record label Mark Planet, allowing him greater creative control over his music following his earlier solo work. Under this label, he released the mini album Polygon on May 11, 2017, consisting of five tracks including "Beautiful Things," "The Maze of Reality," and collaborations that showcased his evolving R&B style. [15] The album received positive reception and marked his first major release as an independent artist. Ha Dong-kyun has since focused on consistent single releases and live performances. He held his inaugural solo concert series Night: The First in June 2017 at Blue Square iMarket Hall. [16] Subsequent solo concerts have included Here I Am in October 2021 at Blue Square Mastercard Hall, ROOTS in November 2023, and PIECE in December 2024, reflecting his ongoing commitment to intimate live engagements with fans. [16] Recent singles include the 2024 single "I Will" (내가 그댈), demonstrating his continued activity in the music scene. [17] While pursuing his solo career, Ha Dong-kyun has maintained ties with his group Wanted, which has operated on intermittent hiatus patterns since the mid-2010s but continues occasional group-related appearances and contributions. [1] His work under Mark Planet emphasizes personal expression through ballads and collaborations, sustaining his presence as a respected vocalist in the Korean music industry. [3] Contributions to film and television Original soundtracks for dramas Ha Dong-kyun has contributed to numerous original soundtracks for Korean television dramas, providing emotive ballad performances that align with the emotional narratives of the series. His OST work spans multiple genres, from historical and romantic dramas to medical and thriller productions, often highlighting his powerful vocal delivery and ability to convey deep sentiment. Among his notable contributions is the duet "I Will Be Waiting" (기다릴게) with Lee Jung for the 2011 MBC historical drama The Princess' Man. [18] The track gained attention for its heartfelt lyrics. In the same year, he released "After The Love" for the SBS romantic comedy Twinkle Twinkle. [19] He followed with "Corner of My Heart" (가슴 한쪽) for the 2012 SBS drama Take Care of Us, Captain and "Looks Good" (좋아보여) for the 2013 KBS medical drama Good Doctor. [10] [10] In later years, Ha Dong-kyun continued his OST involvement with tracks such as "Home" for the 2018 JTBC medical drama Life, "Don't Remember" for the 2018 MBC drama Bad Papa, "Just Leave Me" (그냥 나를 버려요) for the highly popular 2020 JTBC series The World of the Married, "Set Me Free" for the 2020 tvN drama Day and Night, "Talking to Myself" (혼잣말) for the 2021 JTBC drama Human Disqualification, and "Killing Me" for the 2022 SBS drama Again My Life. [20] [21] [22] [23] [24] [25] These songs reflect his consistent presence in drama soundtracks, complementing on-screen stories with his signature style. Variety shows and music program appearances Ha Dong-kyun has frequently appeared as a performer, contestant, or guest on South Korean music competition shows, variety programs, and performance-based television formats, highlighting his vocal prowess and engaging personality. [2] [26] In 2019, he joined as a regular member of the second lineup for The Call Season 2, a collaborative music variety show that paired artists for performances. [2] He continued this trend in 2023 by serving as a regular cast member on Begin Again Season 5: Intermission, a program featuring acoustic performances and musical interactions. [2] More recently, in 2024, Ha Dong-kyun appeared on Song Stealer as a Song Stealer in two episodes and as a performer on SynchroU in one episode. [26] [2] He has also made guest appearances on long-running talk and music variety shows, including You Hee-yeol's Sketchbook in 2017 and Happy Together in 2018. [26] These appearances have complemented his music career by providing platforms to perform and connect with audiences beyond album releases. Discography Albums, EPs, and singles overview Ha Dong-kyun's discography as a solo artist consists of two studio albums, three mini-albums, and a series of singles and digital releases that highlight his distinctive husky vocal style and ballad-oriented songwriting. [2] His early solo work focused on full-length albums, beginning with the debut studio album Stand Alone, released on June 27, 2006, which featured popular tracks such as "그녀를 사랑해줘요" and helped establish him in the music scene after his group activities. [27] This was followed by his second studio album Another Corner on February 12, 2008, which included the lead single "나비야" and continued his exploration of emotional R&B ballads. [28] After a period of lower activity, Ha Dong-kyun shifted toward mini-albums and more frequent digital releases in the 2010s. [29] He released the mini-album Mark in December 2012, followed by Word in October 2014, and Polygon in May 2017 under his independent label Mark Planet, with the latter featuring tracks like "지금 그리고 우린" as its title song. [30] [31] Key singles during this era include "Beautiful Day" in May 2015 and "그래 사랑이었다" in March 2017, which showcased his continued focus on heartfelt lyrics and melodies. [27] In recent years, Ha Dong-kyun has primarily released digital singles, maintaining his presence with tracks such as "I Will" in 2024 and others that reflect his ongoing evolution as a singer-songwriter. [27] His releases often emphasize personal and emotional themes, with limited emphasis on commercial chart performance in the streaming era compared to his earlier album-driven success.
